qas.question: When did Eastern Slavs become the dominant group in the area of Ukraine?
What countries did Kievan Rus' become?
What was the main language in Kievan Rus'?
When did Kievan Rus' adopt Christianity?
What group of dialects did Christians speak in 1000 AD?
When were historic records first kept?
What commercial language was adopted by Christians in 880?
What countries trace their origins to Greece?

context: Judging by the historical records, by <a0_0>approximately <b7_0>1000 AD<b7_0/><a0_0/> the predominant ethnic group over much of modern European Russia, Ukraine and Belarus was the Eastern branch of the Slavs, speaking <b5_0>a closely related group<b5_0/> of dialects. The political unification of this region into Kievan Rus' in <a1_0>about 880<a1_0/>, from which <a2_0><b9_0>modern Russia, Ukraine and Belarus<b9_0/><a2_0/> trace their origins, established <a3_0><b8_0>Old East Slavic<b8_0/><a3_0/> as a literary and commercial language. It was soon followed by the adoption of Christianity in <a4_0><b6_0>988<b6_0/><a4_0/> and the introduction of the South Slavic Old Church Slavonic as the liturgical and official language. Borrowings and calques from Byzantine Greek began to enter the Old East Slavic and spoken dialects at this time, which in their turn modified the Old Church Slavonic as well.
